title: Sources: Sumrall the favorite to land Florida job
content: Tulane's Jon Sumrall has emerged as the clear favorite to be the next head coach at Florida, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Browns open to extended Shedeur look
content: The Browns are open to giving Shedeur Sanders an extended look as their starting quarterback for the rest of this season, sources told ESPN.

title: Ragnow fails physical, won't join Lions this season
content: Four-time Pro Bowl center Frank Ragnow has failed his physical and will not play for the Lions this season, the team announced.

title: U-M's Barham flagged for head-butting official
content: Michigan linebacker Jaishawn Barham was flagged for heat-butting an official during the first quarter against Ohio State -- but he was not ejected.

title: Texas lands first 2027 commit in 5-star WR Royal
content: Texas landed a commitment in the 2027 class when five-star wide receiver Easton Royal picked the Longhorns.

title: 'No Plan B' if Olympic hockey arena is not ready
content: An official for the 2026 Milan-Cortina Olympics said "there is no Plan B" if the main ice hockey arena, which is still under construction, is not ready for the Winter Games.

title: Kiffin to make 'hard decision' on future Saturday
content: Lane Kiffin said he will decide Saturday whether he will return as Ole Miss' coach in 2026 or take another job, presumably at LSU.

title: Norris calls Verstappen's F1 title jab 'nonsense'
content: Lando Norris said he welcomes title rival Max Verstappen talking "nonsense" about this year's title fight, but insists he will remain fully focused on winning this year's world championship.

title: WWE Survivor Series: Key stats and info to know before WarGames
content: As we approach Saturday's WWE premium live event, let's catch up on some notes and stats for each match.

title: Final prep for NFL Week 13: We have sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Should we be concerned about Brock Purdy? Could the Titans and Browns pull off upsets? And is Trevor Lawrence startable in fantasy in Week 13?

title: Chaos on the field and off: Headlines, top memories from Vanderbilt's last win at Neyland
content: Vanderbilt's 2017 win over Tennessee was memorable on the field, but soon after came one of the more remarkable coaching carousel sagas in recent memory.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Magic, Thunder secure top seeds
content: The 2025 NBA Cup continues as group play wraps up. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament.

title: Repeating as Premier League champions is hard -- as Liverpool are finding out
content: Liverpool's collapse is part of a common trend of Premier League champions struggling to keep up their form the next season. Why is that?

title: Germany's missed chances open up Nations League final vs. Spain
content: Tuesday will be the decider for the title, but Germany missed a chance in their first leg against Spain.

title: Buzz: A closer look at Baker Mayfield's injury and why he's expected to play Sunday
content: After leaving last week's game early due to a shoulder injury, Baker Mayfield is trending toward playing Sunday against Arizona.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: What happens if there's no deal at the end of the 30 days?
content: How far apart are the two sides and what if a deal isn't in place by the Sunday WNBA deadline for a new CBA?

title: Oregon, Ole Miss and Virginia headline best Week 14 uniforms in college football
content: Oregon has a typically colorful look while Virginia will be donning throwbacks, among other sleek threads from across the regular season's final week.

title: Inside weird and wonderful college football rivalry trophies
content: What do an axe, skillet and a gold boot have in common? Meet the iconic rivalry trophies of college football.

title: Conference finals preview: Can Müller lead the Caps to MLS Cup?
content: The MLS postseason is down to four teams, with Lionel Messi and Thomas Müller providing plenty of star power, but will it be enough to get to MLS Cup?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea keen to land Forest defender Murillo
content: Chelsea retain an interest in Nottingham Forest center back Murillo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 23XI vs. NASCAR trial: Why Michael Jordan & Co. want to tear up stock car racing
content: The antitrust suit against NASCAR goes to court on Monday, in a trial that could tear at the fabric of stock car racing as we know it.

title: Gaza Death Count Crosses 70,000; Over 350 Dead Since Ceasefire
content: The health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza on Saturday said more than 70,000 people have been killed since the war between Israel and Hamas erupted more than two years ago.

title: Oscar-Winning British Playwright Tom Stoppard Dies At 88
content: British playwright Tom Stoppard, who won an Oscar for the screenplay for the 1998 movie "Shakespeare In Love", has died at the age of 88.

title: Cyclone Ditwah LIVE Updates: Cyclone Ditwah Nears Tamil Nadu, Disaster Response Teams On Standby
content: Cyclone Ditwah LIVE News Updates: Cyclone Ditwah is likely to continue to move north-northwestwards and reach over southwest Bay of Bengal near North Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and adjoining south Andhra Coasts by November 30, the weather agency said.

title: This Tamil Nadu Town Had World's Earliest Democracy Model
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's recent reference to the famed Uttaramerur inscriptions in Tamil Nadu has sparked fresh public interest in what many historians and scholars describe as one of the world's earliest and most detailed models of democracy.

title: "Arvind Kejriwal Betrayed Everyone": 2-Time AAP MLA Joins BJP In Delhi
content: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader and two-time MLA Rajesh Gupta joined the BJP on Saturday ahead of the civic polls. Delhi BJP president Virendra Sachdeva welcomed him into the party.

title: Anmol Bishnoi Fears Being Killed By Pak Gangster, Files Plea In Court
content: Anmol Bishnoi, brother of dreaded gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, has filed a protection application, citing "apprehension of being targeted and killed" by a Pakistani gangster, Shehzad Bhatti, allegedly due to his recent posts on social media.

title: Red Alert In Tamil Nadu, Andhra, Puducherry As Cyclone Ditwah Inches Closer
content: Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Puducherry need to brace for more torrential rains as cyclone Ditwah is moving towards the Indian coast, the chief of the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said today.

title: 4 Dead, 2 Injured After Fire At Four-Storey Building In Delhi: Cops
content: Four people died and two women were injured after a massive fire broke out at a footwear shop in south Delhi's Sangam Vihar today, Delhi Fire Service officials said.

title: Karnataka's Familiar Tug-Of-War: Siddaramaiah vs DKS And A 2007 Shadow
content: Karnataka is again living through a crisis that feels eerily familiar. Over the last week senior Congress leaders, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and his deputy DK Shivakumar, moved from open rivalry to a breakfast featuring upma, idli, and sambar.

title: Report Recommending Tribal Status To 6 Communities Tabled In Assam Assembly
content: In a very significant development, an interim report of the Group of Ministers (GoM) of the Assam government over the proposal to grant Scheduled Tribe (ST) status to six major communities was laid in the state assembly on the last day of the winter

title: 'Even 10 Trumps Won't Fix This': Ex-US Soldier Slams Afghan Immigration Ban
content: Former US soldier Ahmad Shah Mohibi has pushed back against the Trump administration's sweeping crackdown on Afghan immigrants following the Washington, DC shooting involving Afghan-origin suspect Rahmanullah Lakanwal.

title: Air India Not Business Opportunity, But Responsibility: N Chandrasekaran
content: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran on Saturday said Air India, which is undergoing a transformation, is not just a business opportunity but a "responsibility" for the Tata Group.

title: Travel Chaos Fears Ease After Airbus Update On A320 Software Upgrade
content: Fears of days of travel chaos across Europe and the world eased on Saturday after plane manufacturer Airbus intervened rapidly to implement a software upgrade it had said was immediately needed on some 6,000 of its stalwart A320 planes.

title: Jamiat Chief Says Top Court 'Under Government Pressure', BJP Hits Back
content: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind president Maulana Mahmood Madani alleged that Muslims across the country were being targeted for their "religious attire, identity, and lifestyle".

title: Trump Says Venezuela Airspace Should Be Considered "Closed In Its Entirety"
content: US President Donald Trump warned on Saturday that the airspace above and near Venezuela should be considered closed, the latest escalation in a standoff with leftist leader Nicolas Maduro.

title: 5-Year-Old Boy Dies After Attack By Wolves In UP's Bahraich
content: A five-year-old boy has died in Kaisarganj - a tehsil in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich district that has witnessed a spate of wolf attacks of late - from injuries sustained in an attack by the animal, officials said on Saturday.

title: Former Bangladesh PM Khaleda Zia In Intensive Care
content: Former Bangladesh prime minister Khaleda Zia was being treated in intensive care on Saturday, prompting her family and party members to urge citizens to pray for her speedy recovery.

title: Australian PM Anthony Albanese Marries At 62, Dog Toto Is Ring Bearer
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese married his girlfriend Jodie Haydon on Saturday, becoming the country's first leader to tie the knot while in office.

title: 52 'Sorrys' In 4 Minutes Ignored: Class 8 Boy Jumps From School Building
content: A Class 8 student, a national-level skating player, attempted suicide by jumping from the third floor of his private school in Dongre Nagar in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam on Friday.

title: "Booth Officials Being Threatened Openly": Bengal BJP Chief Criticises Poll Body
content: BJP's West Bengal unit chief Samik Bhattacharya today raised serious concerns over Booth Level Officers (BLOs) "being intimidated in full public view," while criticising the Election Commission.

title: Justice Surya Kant: Striking a balance in a divided nation
content: The new Chief Justice of India, who will serve until February 2027, believes that justice is not merely about resolving disputes, but about ‘protecting the innocent from being lost in the storms of circumstance’

title: Over 50,000 citizens write to Supreme Court against stray dogs order
content: The organisers said that they had asked people across the country to visit their nearest post office on November 29 and mail a letter to the Chief Justice of India seeking a stay, recall and reconsideration of the order

title: KCR’s fast was a defining moment: KTR
content: BRS working president says Congress for ever remains a villain in Telangana’s history for being responsible for forcible merger, exploitation

title: Delhi blast: NIA team arrests 2 from Uttarakhand's
content: The NIA team and Uttarakhand Police personnel went to a mosque in Nainital to question some people, the official said

title: Passing-out parade held at Indian Naval Academy
content: The parade was reviewed by Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan, who congratulated the midshipmen and cadets for their achievement

title: Cyclone Ditwah triggers light showers in Tirupati, Nellore and Chittoor districts
content: The cyclonic storm is likely to weakened into depression by the time it reaches Andhra Pradesh coast, says IMD

title: BJP government’s betrayal of Tamil Nadu unacceptable, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: In a social media message, he says the State has achieved 11.19 % growth, the highest in the country, despite the Centre’s indifference

title: Kerala’s waste makeover meets poll silence
content: Two years after the Brahmapuram landfill fire triggered sweeping reforms, waste management slips off campaign agendas even as major gains and unresolved gaps continue to shape the waste management landscape. The issue still demands sustained funding and vigilant oversight

title: Dalrymple urges Maharashtra government to spotlight unknown treasures at Ellora Caves
content: The empty tomb of the last Ottoman Caliph and the tombs of the Ahmednagar Sultanate’s Peshwas could attract international tourists, says Scottish historian, deploring their current state of “utter neglect”

title: Day after meeting with EC, Trinamool Congress asks poll body to release transcript
content: The party had raised five questions about the special intensive revision in the State, including the recent “SIR-related” deaths, at the meeting

title: Both LDF, UDF hopeful of helming Kochi Corporation
content: The LDF maintained a three-decade winning streak in the Corporation till 2010. For the next two terms, it was the UDF’s turn. In 2020, the Left front reclaimed the civic body, with the help of Independents and rebels

title: LPS 2.0: 16,666 acres for Global Sports City, railway network and IRR in Amaravati
content: Municipal Administration Minister P. Narayana assures that farmers participating in the latest land pooling will get compensation on par with the first phase

title: CSIR-NAL unveils ‘production grade’ Hansa-3 plane
content: M/s Pioneer Clean Amps, which will manufacture the two-seater planes, has set up a ₹150 crore facility in Kuppam, Andhra Pradesh, to make 100 aircraft annually

title: India sends more relief to Sri Lanka after Cyclone Ditwah
content: Besides deploying INS Vikrant and INS Udaygiri, India has sent INS Sukanya with relief materials to the island nation; two NDRF teams equipped with boats, medical aid and advanced tools have reached Colombo

title: Telangana government clears procurement 3K MW solar power, UG cabling project in Hyderabad
content: The Telangana Renewable Energy Development Corporation proposed to take up the process of procurement of 5,000 MW solar power through competitive bidding in coordination with Discoms

title: Two Lucknow men get 20 months jail for involvement in al- Qaeda linked terror conspiracy case
content: Earlier, on October 30, the court had convicted Mohammad Moid of Lucknow in the same case, related to the arrest of two al-Qaeda members

title: J&K L-G launches construction of 530 new homes for calamity-hit families in Ramban, Udhampur
content: A total of 1,500 homes will be built across the Union Territory for families affected by recent natural calamities and unprovoked Pakistani shelling during Operation Sindoor in the first phase

title: WhatsApp ordered to enforce ‘SIM binding,’ log out web sessions every 6 hours
content: In its first significant foray into regulating messaging platforms, the Department of Telecommunications ordered WhatsApp and other apps like it to make sure their services only worked if a user’s registered SIM was physically in the device.

title: Lakhs of voters may be excluded from electoral rolls in Rajasthan: Congress
content: Internal assessments had indicated that the names of 25 lakh voters could be struck off as the EC had marked over 27 lakh voter forms as uncollected, Congress leader Govind Singh Dotasra said

title: Constitution is evolving to ‘swadeshi’, says Presidential Reference Bench
content: Despite the influences from abroad, the interpretation and working of the Constitution over the decades have given it a truly ‘swadeshi’ colour, the top court said

title: Varsha Gaikwad accuses Mahayuti government of turning Mumbai into a gas chamber
content: Congress leader cites rising pollution and Bombay High Court’s concerns, urges urgent action to protect Mumbai’s air quality

title: Scientists warn Centre against accepting ‘compromise formula’ at plant treaty meet in Peru
content: In a letter to the Union Agriculture Minister, the Scientists for Genetic Diversity group said the proposal allows multinational enterprises to gain unfettered control over the vital genetic resources of the Global South

title: RPF, GRP launch stringent measures to curb reckless railway track crossing
content: Squads are now conducting intensive flash checks around major railway stations following reports of increasing violations, some of which have resulted in fatalities

title: Delhi air pollution a ‘slow poison’, Congress seeks all-party panel and hits out at freebie politics
content: Congress says Delhi pollution crisis a national problem, urges MP-level committee and action on vehicular emissions

title: India, Bangladesh need to cooperate on ‘grey areas’ in Bay of Bengal maritime boundaries
content: A UN Tribunal on the India-Bangladesh maritime boundary dispute in 2014 awarded Bangladesh 19,467 sq. km of the 25,602 sq km sea area of Bay of Bengal

title: Citizens of Electronics City and Anekal seek urgent road upgrades
content: The memorandum highlights the poor condition of key roads and the growing hardships faced by thousands of commuters, residents, and farmers

title: SIR being undertaken in poorly planned manner, EC should halt it: CPI(M)
content: The CPI(M) alleged that this haste has led to complaints at several places of BLOs camping in some party offices and asking voters to visit them.

title: EVM distribution begins in Kottayam
content: A total of 1,925 officers will be designated as presiding officer, first polling officer, second polling officer and third polling officer

title: BJP MLA wants Satish Jarkiholi to be made CM
content: BJP MLA from Raibag Duryodhan Aihole has said that said that Congress leader Satish Jarkihole, a dalit leader, should become chief minister of the state.

title: After delta, south coastal districts, Ditwah to batter north T.N.
content: Rain triggered by cyclone damages crops, inundates residential areas and salt pans; north Tamil Nadu to get heavy rain and situation is likely to ease from Monday, says Met office

title: CM Omar Abdullah pins hope on snowfall to revive J&K's tourism; calls for sustainable development
content: "This year has not been easy for us from a tourism point of view. Be it Pahalgam, Delhi, and Nowgam, it has had a huge impact on our tourism," Mr. Abdullah says

title: Priyank Kharge seeks Central share of funds for Jal Jeevan Mission
content: Minister for Rural Development and Panchayati Raj and IT/BT Priyank Kharge on Saturday urged Union Jal Shakti Minister C.R. Patil to release the pending share of Central funds under the Jal Jeevan Mission to Karnataka to ensure timely completion of works and enable access to safe drinking water for rural households

title: TDB moves to revive Sabarimala master plan
content: Travancore Devaswom Board president K. Jayakumar convenes a meeting on December 16 to review the status of projects in Sabarimala and identify mid-term priorities. An update on status will be given to the high-power committee

title: Telangana government committed to go only for pit-head thermal power plants, says Deputy Chief Minister
content: Bhatti Vikramarka says previous Bharat Rashtra Samithi government neglected battery energy storage systems, pumped storage power generation badly in 10 years

title: Thiruvalla legislator Mathew T. Thomas, wife find their name missing from voter list
content: The MLA says both he and his wife had cast their ballots in every election since 1984. However, officials have reportedly told him that the names cannot be incorporated into the system due to technical constraints.

title: Guest lecturers’ agitation enters sixth day
content: The indefinite agitation launched by guest lecturers opposing the counselling process being held by the government for selection of guest faculty has entered the sixth day in Gadag on Saturday and meanwhile various organisations have extended support to the ongoing agitation.

title: BJP aims for 25% vote share, says K. Surendran
content: Local bodies are testing grounds for the coming Assembly polls, says former BJP State president as he unveils party’s micro-targeted strategies across the State

title: Veekshanam editorial ‘defending’ Mamkootathil catches Congress unawares
content: The party mouthpiece’s editorial quoted from the gospel, stating that “let those who have not sinned throw stones”. KPCC president says the article contravenes the party’s official line on the controversy. ‘Tactless editorial’ was the result of a lack of journalistic caution, says Veekshanam MD

title: Nationalism is ‘not an issue in India’, says RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: ‘Our nature and culture are to progress together. This is not the case with many foreign nations,’ Mohan Bhagwat said

title: KATPS to establish guidelines for sky-dining facilities
content: Move comes against the backdrop of five people getting stuck in a sky-dining restaurant at Anachal, near Munnar, in Idukki on Friday

title: SIR issue to be brought up in Lok Sabha winter session: VCK chief
content: He says the workers involved in SIR are under tremendous stress and some have even attempted to end their lives, and the situation is worsening

title: Transgender reservation comes into effect in law colleges in Kerala
content: Esai Clara, the transwoman who moved the High Court demanding reservation for transgender persons for LLB course, plans to join Government Law College, Kozhikode

title: Danger ahead! 715 dead in 2023, 486 more in 2024 as India’s longest highway becomes deadliest
content: India's longest highway, NH-44, particularly its Haryana and Delhi stretches, has become a deadly corridor with alarming accident rates. In 2023, 715 deaths occurred on Haryana's NH-44 alone, a grim statistic reflecting a national road safety crisis exacerbated by speeding, design flaws, and inadequate infrastructure.

title: Airbus software fix: DGCA says over 322 aircraft updated; completion likely soon
content: Airlines are urgently upgrading Airbus A320 aircraft software. Intense solar radiation could corrupt flight data. This directive follows an incident where an aircraft pitched downwards unexpectedly. IndiGo, Air India, and Air India Express are accelerating fixes. No aircraft can fly until the mandatory modification is complete. This global alert impacts thousands of jets, causing travel disruptions.

title: Congress top brass stares at tough test after Siddaramaiah-Shivakumar truce
content: A breakfast meeting between Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar has temporarily eased the leadership tension, with Siddaramaiah reportedly suggesting Shivakumar take over after 2028. This arrangement, however, complicates a planned transition, leaving the party high command to navigate delicate caste dynamics and political calculations.

title: Canada-returned woman arrested for husband’s murder
content: A woman, Rupinder Kaur, recently returned from Canada, has been arrested for allegedly conspiring with her paramour, Harkanwalpreet Singh, to murder her husband, Gurwinder Singh, in Faridkot. The victim's sister alleged Rupinder had suspicions about her wife's character and a possible affair. Investigations are underway regarding their Canadian connections.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Flights canceled, schools shut; shelters set up — how India is bracing for impact
content: Cyclone Ditwah is nearing India's North Tamil Nadu coast, bringing warnings of extreme rainfall and strong winds. After causing significant devastation and over 150 deaths in Sri Lanka, the storm's approach has prompted widespread evacuations, flight cancellations, and school closures across southern Indian states. Relief efforts are underway, with authorities on high alert.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: Inside the deal-making power of the F-35: A weapon, a network, a strategic lock-in
content: The F-35 is the United States’ one of the strongest bargaining chip because it is irreplaceable — no rival offers its stealth maturity, network warfare capability or global support infrastructure. Nations that qualify to fly it join the most advanced military ecosystem in existence; those excluded remain outside the intelligence-fusion loop that defines modern air combat.

title: ‘Selective targeting’: Journalist’s house razed in Jammu; CM Omar hits out at Raj Bhavan
content: Journalist Arafaz Ahmad Daing's home demolition in Jammu has ignited a political firestorm. Deputy CM Surinder Choudhary is demanding an inquiry, questioning who ordered the action. Former BJP President Ravinder Raina also visited, claiming the LG's administration wasn't involved. CM Omar Abdullah accused Raj Bhavan-posted officers of selective demolitions, undermining the elected government.

title: US tariffs: Mark Carney tells Canadians; Levies will wipe $50 billion from Canada's economy
content: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney is rolling back climate rules and encouraging pipeline construction to boost the energy sector amidst US tariff uncertainty. This move aims to diversify oil exports and reduce reliance on the US market, though it sparks internal government tensions and environmentalist criticism.

title: ‘Refused marriage’: Woman shot dead in Noida; ex-boyfriend on the run
content: A 23-year-old woman was fatally shot by her ex-boyfriend in Noida after she refused his marriage proposal. The accused, Krishna, allegedly forced his way into her home and fired shots when she resisted. He then threatened neighbours before fleeing. Police have registered a murder case and are actively searching for the suspect.

title: CJ Stroud injury update: Texans get boost as QB returns vs Colts
content: Houston Texans quarterback C.J. Stroud has been cleared to play against the Indianapolis Colts in Week 13 after recovering from a concussion. His return is crucial for the Texans' playoff aspirations, as they aim to improve their 6-5 record and gain ground in the AFC South. Stroud's presence is expected to reignite the offense, which has struggled in his absence.

title: 'Content is king': Kevin O’Leary advices students; claims creators earn biggest paydays
content: Shark Tank investor Kevin O'Leary has reversed his advice to students, now highlighting creative storytelling and content creation as the fastest-growing wage earners. He stated that elite content creators are achieving significant incomes by driving online sales and reducing customer acquisition costs, a stark contrast to his previous emphasis on engineering degrees.

title: Seeking divine intervention? DKS's temple run after 'truce' with Sidda; feels 'sense of glory'
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar visited a temple after a breakfast meeting with CM Siddaramaiah amid a power tussle. Shivakumar, who faced legal challenges, expressed a sense of glory at the temple. The meeting followed reports of a power-sharing agreement between the two leaders after the 2023 assembly elections.

title: Who is Anamaria Goltes? Meet Lakers star Luka Doncic’s fiancée
content: Luka Doncic's childhood sweetheart, Anamaria Goltes, a Slovenian model and entrepreneur, has been his unwavering support. The couple, who met as children, are building a life in Los Angeles with their daughter. Goltes skillfully balances her modeling career, influencer status, and life as a partner to a basketball superstar, adapting to his moves and embracing the spotlight.

title: ‘Severe beatings, dog attacks’: UN flags systemic torture by Israel in new report
content: A UN report details widespread torture and abuses against Palestinian detainees by Israeli security forces over the past two years, including severe beatings, dog attacks, and denial of medical care.

title: Nelly Korda engaged to Casey Gunderson after tough winless season
content: World number two golfer Nelly Korda announced her engagement to partner Casey Gunderson on Instagram, sharing sweet photos just days after concluding her LPGA season. The news was met with widespread congratulations from fans and notable figures across sports, including LeBron James and Caitlin Clark. This happy milestone follows her brother Sebastian Korda's recent engagement.

title: Perez Hilton reacts as Meghan Markle accused of keeping $1,700 photoshoot gown
content: A resurfaced rumor about Meghan Markle taking a designer gown without permission, dubbed "Green Gown-gate," has sparked debate. Podcaster Perez Hilton defended Meghan, calling the claims "nonsense." Meanwhile, Meghan and Prince Harry actively participated in a Thanksgiving meal packing event through their Archewell Foundation, offering a positive counterpoint to the dress controversy.

title: NBA rumors: Lakers eye $186M Bucks star as they plan league’s next superteam
content: Whispers are growing louder about the Los Angeles Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo.  Reports suggest the franchise is exploring aggressive moves to build a future around Luka Dončić, even considering significant short-term sacrifices.  Complex multi-team trade scenarios are circulating, aiming to reshape multiple NBA rosters and create new championship contenders.

title: 'Work tirelessly at field': EC doubles remuneration of BLOs; hikes pay for supervisors
content: Election Commission has doubled Booth Level Officers' pay to Rs 12,000 and supervisors' to Rs 18,000, acknowledging their crucial role. This comes as the BJP forms a team to monitor electoral roll revisions and address BLO issues, amid reports of BLO deaths and protests over workload.

title: The return of Rama: A 500-year-old struggle that restored the prince of Ayodhya
content: Ayodhya's 500-year Ram Janmabhoomi struggle culminated on January 22, 2024, with the consecration of the Ram Lalla temple. This event marked the physical manifestation of faith, fulfilling a centuries-long aspiration. The journey, from Maharishi Valmiki's depiction of Ram's exile to modern movements and legal battles, finally saw the temple stand as a reclaimed heritage.

title: Neurosurgeon with 25 years of experience shares 10 habits that make the brain smarter
content: Neuroscience reveals that consistent habits can reshape the brain, enhancing thinking, learning, and stress resilience. AIIMS-trained Neurosurgeon Dr. Arun L Naik shares 10 key habits, from consistent sleep to daily learning, that stimulate neural circuits and foster a smarter brain. Practicing these daily leads to sharper recall and peak performance.

title: Candace Owens and Charlie Kirk controversy explained: Inside her statements on Erika Kirk
content: Candace Owens is raising questions about the death of Charlie Kirk. She alleges involvement of French President Emmanuel Macron and foreign forces. News groups and fact-checkers state no proof exists for these claims. French officials have denied the allegations. Candace Owens continues to post new theories, creating a significant controversy.

title: Pujara’s brother-in-law found dead at Rajkot home: What we know so far
content: Businessman Jeet Pabari, brother-in-law of cricketer Cheteshwar Pujara, was found dead at his Rajkot residence on Wednesday, reportedly by suicide. Family members stated he had been battling depression for two months. The incident occurred a year after a rape complaint was filed against him, for which he had secured anticipatory bail.

title: Veiled jibe at the US? Jaishankar says politics now ‘trumps’ economics
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar stated that the world is now in an era where politics increasingly influences economics, urging India to diversify supply sources to protect national interests. He highlighted global fragmentation and supply insecurity, emphasising India's pursuit of self-reliance and manufacturing growth to secure its future.

title: Best food pairings for heart, bone and brain health from morning to night
content: Unlock peak nutrition by combining foods that boost each other's benefits.  Pairing ingredients like olive oil with vegetables enhances heart health, while vitamin D sources with calcium-rich foods strengthen bones.  Yogurt with berries supports gut and brain function, and iron-rich foods with vitamin C improve mental performance.  These synergistic pairings amplify health impacts for better overall wellness.

title: US tariffs bite: India’s engineering exports slump 16.7% in October
content: India's engineering exports plunged 16.71% in October 2025, hitting $9.37 billion, largely due to a significant drop in shipments to the US and a high base effect. Key markets like Asean also saw steep declines. Despite this monthly dip, cumulative exports for April-October 2025 showed a modest 1.68% growth.

title: Ed Sheeran, Taylor Swift talk at length after her engagement to Travis Kelce
content: Pop superstar Taylor Swift's close friend Ed Sheeran only learned of her engagement to Travis Kelce a week after the news broke. Sheeran revealed he's ditched social media and his iPad, preferring in-person connections. He and Swift recently had a four-hour catch-up, highlighting their deep, effortless friendship that transcends digital updates.

title: PSL over IPL! Faf du Plessis pulls out of Indian Premier League to play in Pak
content: Former South Africa captain Faf du Plessis will not enter the upcoming IPL auction, opting instead for the Pakistan Super League after 14 seasons in India. Du Plessis, a consistent performer for CSK and RCB, thanked franchises and fans for his IPL journey. He communicated this decision through a post on Instagram.

title: 'This is Virat, mayday': Ukraine 'claims' strike on two Russian oil tankers
content: A Russian oil tanker, the Virat, was struck by an unmanned vessel in the Black Sea near the Turkish coast, with explosions reported. Another vessel, the Kairos, also experienced an explosion. In footage of a crew member aboard Virat, a man reports it to be a drone attack in panic. Ukrainian sources have claimed responsibility, stating they targeted the ships for allegedly transporting sanctioned Russian oil.

title: Are we celebrating mediocrity, coach Gautam Gambhir?
content: The focus will soon shift to ODIs and another ICC tournament but it's been a difficult couple of weeks for Indian cricket as once-unshakable home dominance has crumbled under Gautam Gambhir, with two Test series defeats in a year and their heaviest loss by runs in history. Instead of accountability, Gambhir has leaned on his past glories

title: Vanessa Bryant turns Disneyland into family adventure as daughters shine
content: Vanessa Bryant recently shared a heartwarming glimpse of a Disneyland outing with her daughters Natalia, Bianka, and Capri on Instagram. The philanthropist has been a steadfast presence for her girls, balancing their needs with her own grief. Bryant expressed immense pride in Natalia's resilience and maturity, highlighting her role as a supportive big sister and daughter.

title: Al-Qaeda conspiracy case: NIA sentences 2 more to 20 months in jail; 6 accused under probe
content: A special NIA court has convicted two more individuals, Mohd. Mustaqueem and Shakeel, in an Al-Qaeda conspiracy case, sentencing them to 20 months in prison. This follows a previous conviction in the same plot, which aimed to carry out terror attacks in Uttar Pradesh. The accused were found guilty of procuring weapons and ammunition for the banned outfit's affiliate.

title: ‘Closed in its entirety’: Trump orders complete shutdown of Venezuelan airspace
content: US President Donald Trump has declared Venezuelan airspace entirely closed to all airlines, pilots, drug dealers, and human traffickers. This move follows new US measures against alleged Venezuelan drug-trafficking networks, with ground strikes planned soon.  The US has also designated President Maduro and associates as a foreign terrorist organization, expanding sanctions authority.

title: Sidda vs DKS: Will the breakfast diplomacy hold? Congress dilemma in Karnataka explained
content: Karnataka's Congress faces a leadership dilemma as Chief minister Siddaramaiah and deputy CM DK Shivakumar present a united front after intense speculation. The party grapples with balancing the influential AHINDA coalition and Vokkaliga support, crucial for its electoral success, as a potential midterm leadership change remains unresolved.

title: ‘We have all the cards’: Trump touts tariffs as cornerstone of US strength
content: Donald Trump asserted his tariff regime has made the U.S. "Rich, Strong, Powerful, and Safe," claiming it has stopped wars, strengthened alliances, and boosted the stock market. He attributed these outcomes to "Strong Leadership and TARIFFS," as tariff revenues have significantly increased, with a Supreme Court ruling on presidential authority pending.

title: 'Beating India... one of the best': Babar stokes fire; brags about Pakistan's win as captain
content: Pakistan captain Babar Azam cherishes the historic 2021 World Cup victory against India in Dubai as his most treasured moment.  He revealed seeking insights from top cricketers like Virat Kohli on preparation and mental discipline.  Azam emphasized that this monumental win, Pakistan's first against India in a World Cup, remains unparalleled in his career.

title: Kapil Sharma cafe shooting: Gang planned to kill comedian; chilling details emerge
content: Delhi Crime Branch apprehended Ludhiana gangster Bandhu Maan Singh Sekhon, sought by Canada for attacks on Kapil Sharma's cafe. Sekhon, linked to ISI operative Harry Chatha, confessed the gang threatened to kill Sharma if demands weren't met. The cafe faced three shootings, with footage circulated to amplify threats. Sekhon's arrest followed a trail from a missing pistol.

title: Cardi B shares heartfelt Thanksgiving tribute to Stefon Diggs via Baby Onesie
content: New England Patriots star Stefon Diggs has a new number one fan: his newborn son. Partner Cardi B shared an adorable Instagram moment, dressing their baby boy in a custom Stefon Diggs onesie featuring his current jersey number, '8'. This heartwarming Thanksgiving celebration marks a special time for the couple and their growing family.

title: Live updates: Sayin (three TD passes), Ohio State in control at the Big House
content: Rivalry Week  has already seen one upset that will affect a conference championship and  College Football Playoff  seeding. Could we see another one? On Friday,  Texas   upset   Texas A&M  to give A&M its first loss of the season and knock the Aggies out of the SEC championship game.  Michigan  is in a strikingly similar position.  Ohio State  is undefeated and No. 1 in the CFP rankings. It needs a win to set up a meeting with  Indiana  in next week's Big Ten title game. OSU has been largely unchallenged since defeating Texas in Week 1, and now it faces its biggest rival, which is hasn't beaten in four years. Can the Wolverines pull another upset? It's  "The Game,"  and we're tracking the top moments and biggest plays:

title: 😈 Best trolls from college football Rivalry Week
content: the final week of the college football regular season paired a number of local and long-distance rivals alike . the ability to troll your opponent on social media afterward . Iowa posted a photo of a receipt between a Hawkeyes football helmet and the Heroes Trophy .

title: 'SmackDown' highlights: The Survivor Series elimination tag team match made sense
content: "SmackDown" gave us a traditional Survivor Series elimination tag team match . we also saw LA Knight's surprise opponent, sheamus having to withdraw from "The Last Time Is Now" tournament because of a shoulder injury .
